alert.note: Alert for Bullitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 2:16PM EST until January 04 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Salt River at Shepherdsville affecting Bullitt County. .Heavy rain from the past 12 hours have caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salt River at Shepherdsville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Water covers low spot of KY 61 at north end of bridge. At 33.0 feet, Corner of First and Buckman Street north of bridge flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 33.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 4.4 feet early Friday afternoon. It will rise to 6.0 feet Friday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.9 feet on 02/26/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued tonight.
